name: 42 Macro
title: How Much More Pain Will Global Divergences Cause?
text:
Synopsis
Global economic divergences are creating significant market pressures, with US exceptionalism, sticky inflation, and policy variations driving potential downward pressure on risk assets and continued US dollar strength.

Key Insights
- Three key divergence themes are currently impacting global markets:
  1. US economic growth exceptionalism
  2. Persistent inflation above dovish forecasts
  3. Varying monetary policies across central banks (hawkish Fed and BOJ vs. marginally dovish ECB and PBOC)

- Market indicators reflecting these divergences:
  - 10-year US Treasury yields reaching highest levels since fall 2023
  - US Dollar Index at highest point since fall 2022

- Current market positioning is in an extreme bullish condition, contrasting with bearish positioning in fall 2022 and 2023

- Risk assets have not yet fully priced in the reduction in liquidity implied by recent hawkish developments

- Global liquidity proxy suggests potential downward trend for risk assets
